website_summaries.verdict: In spite of a few quality concerns, numerous customers are happy with its functions and design.
pros: A unique model that stands out for its patented "spin" airtight lid, impact-resistant construction, and angled opening
cons: The lid is somewhat hard to open with one hand
Container is prone to slipping when stacked with others
Some were disappointed with amount of food it holds (thought it would hold more)

customer_reviews.title: and (2) I really disliked the screw lid on the "Home" series versus the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought and returned this unit. I already owned a previous Vittles Vault () that I bought a couple years ago, but had outgrown it. I bought this one, but when it arrived, I noticed two things: (1) the walls of the unit seems thinner than the one I already owned, and (2) I really disliked the screw lid on the "Home" series versus the one on the "Outback." It's rather flimsy whereas the Outback is solid. I used it for about three days before initiating a return. I bought the comparable size from the Outback series () and haven't been happier. I do like the dimensions/footprint of the Home container I returned better than the Outback container.
customer_reviews.author: ROJOVILLA

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service :(
customer_reviews.text: I had previously given these a 5 star rating because they were durable, easy to fill, and will hold a full 40lbs of dog food. After 3 months of use I noticed a crack in the lid. I searched amazon and the viddle vault website looking for a replacement lid with no luck. I found a service email address on the VV website so I reached out. It has been 4 days so far and I have not received any response from the company. When and if I get a response, I will once again give them a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Okay maybe if you buy one but the other shorter wider Vittles Vaults are better
customer_reviews.text: I had some other Vittles Vaults in a different size and loved them so I thought I'd try these out because they have the opening a little more at the top. These are tall and narrow so they aren't as sturdy as I expected them to be. When I start getting down to the bottom the weird shape of the bottoms makes it hard to get the last of the food out of it. The lids are hard to grip and for some reason hard to get lined up. It's almost a two handed process for a lid that is maybe 10". I'm going back to my other Vittles Vaults.
customer_reviews.author: Robin H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product except the lid
customer_reviews.text: Love the shape and size, works perfectly as needed. Holds a big bag of kibble. The only downfall is the lid. It’s not really airtight. As the plastic is flimsy you can overtighten and it actually pops the lid off. We had tiny ants in our kibble the other day. Lid seemed closed but if you don’t get that thread right im sure there’s gaps. Which would also suggest it’s not very airtight Abd not keeping food fresh. Which was the whole point of buying this! Which for the price, you could have bought any plastic container.
customer_reviews.author: Dwest

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to open
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it was just the set that I bought, but it is very difficult to open these things. The threading on the lids is just horrible so I pretty much just smack the lids shut in order to keep them part of the way closed as it would take me 15 minutes to screw them back on and yes, I am able to screw on most items and don't have any kind of disability. Could be they just didn't finish machining the set I have but the openings are also oblong and not in a circle so that may be the reason as well.
customer_reviews.author: kylec12345

customer_reviews.title: After having the vault for only a few weeks both ...
customer_reviews.text: After having the vault for only a few weeks both of the lids cracked. Now neither one of them is airtight.
customer_reviews.author: SMDY

customer_reviews.title: Can't lift them after filling them
customer_reviews.text: The feature this container is missing is some way to easily lift it, once you fill it! There are no handles, no indented spaces - just nowhere to lift them up. Plus, if I had 65 lbs of something in both of them, I wouldn't stack them. It would be too top heavy. I wouldn't care at all about them not stacking IF they only had a way to lift them! I have 6 or 8 other Vittles Vaults and hadn't noticed these had no way to lift them.
customer_reviews.author: uafnanook2001

customer_reviews.title: doesn't compare to earlier version
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed in this purchase. The lid stinks. It doesn't fit properly and is difficult to get lined ip exactly precisely. I have two earlier versions of this container and loved them. One was destroyed by squirrels when they broke into our porch. This new version is just lacking. If I find the earlier version, I'll definitely buy that one again...but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: goldngemgirl

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY! NOT AIRTIGHT!!
customer_reviews.text: It clearly states that it’s suppose to be “airtight”. Anything I buy that’s “airtight” I always test it by filling a little more then half way with water. Then turning it over to see what happens. Well what happen was at the bottom part of the lid doesn’t seal all the way and they water was just pouring out. Which mean ant roaches etc are gonna be able to get into whatever your storing in the container. I recommend to but the outback version. -Gamma2 Vittles Vault Outback Airtight Pet Food Storage Container- the 40lb container is less then $30
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: If you like your dog food fresh this will do it
customer_reviews.text: If your like me, you cant stand the taste of your dog food when it gets as dry as the 10 week old bone you got buried between the couch. For the price it's a large container will hold lots of food. I buy a couple bags and pour em in and this will keep em fresh till the last piece. You do have to turn the lid a lot to open it which is my only gripe but that's probably part of how its keeping things fresh
customer_reviews.author: Shuoink

customer_reviews.title: Not Airtight - not even close.Not suitable for food.
customer_reviews.text: I have had to update this review after owning the product for a couple of months - this product is not close to being airtight - and does not keep food fresh. I will have to find a new solution. Not recommended for any food product, dry or otherwise. have a cupboard 10" wide by 24" deep I wanted to use for storing the dogs food. This seemed to be the perfect size (45lbs) so I ordered. I was worried when it was delivered it would not fit - but I needn't have worried - fits perfectly, does the job perfectly. The entry is as big as it can be and still fit.
customer_reviews.author: Vince O.

customer_reviews.title: NOT pest proof!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this brand of dog food container: its dimensions are thin and low, it's easy to access food, and it is good looking. we ordered two. but they were both chewed all the way through to the food by a rat. we have never seen a rat in our house before and we have set traps. but sadly, we won't be purchasing containers from this company again. and so for us, the search continues!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Great Bin Rotten Lid
customer_reviews.text: The bins themselves are wonderful, sturdy and easy to use... except for the lids. I have to keep a pair of pliers next to them so I can force the lids off! You can turn the lid for an hour and never get it loose. I must apply pressure to break it loose from the last threads. REALLY annoying, especially since I have to do this every day. I use them for dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Good storage, hard to open/close
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After a few months, we noticed there’s a hole in the bottom of one of the legs. A bunch of ants have been appearing underneath!! Hopefully they haven’t made it inside the food itself. Only pro is that the container keeps the smell of the food from stinking up the house Overall this is a great storage container for my pups food and it does not take up too much space. However, not recommended for anyone with grip strength issues. This container is very hard to open and close. My husband has to bang on it to get the track to align prior to twisting it on/off every. time.
customer_reviews.author: Joella B.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: A bit expensive, but this is slightly better than the wheeled, clear flip top container I bought. Although this one could use wheels or something to justify price. Still, I am very happy with the quality and how much dog food it holds given I have an XL breed growing puppy.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to open and close, but does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Great, air-tight dog food storage solution. I only wish the top had a hinge and a latch, instead of screwing on and off. I need to use two hands to open this, and when it's less than half full, I have to hold it in place with my knees while I'm unscrewing the top so it doesn't move around (when it's full of food, the food weighs it down enough to keep it still). This would be WAY more convenient with a latching, hinged lid. But it does the job of keeping insects out of the dog's kibble, which is what I wanted it for.
customer_reviews.author: SharonTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality plastic
customer_reviews.text: Why are plastic products getting worse and worse? My biggest complaint about this storage bin is the little twist on but very easily miss the Reds so that you can continue to rotate it without it ever ceiling very tight. I am very disappointed in the quality and will be returning this item
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus McVey

customer_reviews.title: 0% Air Tight
customer_reviews.text: Yeah these would be great if they did the one job they were supposed to. These are ZERO percent air tight. Absolutely under no circumstance put dog food in them that needs to be air sealed. I bought TWO of these for two different types of dog food. Neither one of them is air tight. Oh and the lids are REALLY hard to get on and off. This product sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: not airtight, lid is CRACKED
customer_reviews.text: i have two, Both have lids which are cracked. right under the label and goes beyond. have to glue or tape it to cover the opening. defective because this is a low - stress area, under the tape and hardly under any stress or strain with opening and closing. too bad. i would have gotten another model --- don't get this one. look at the 40# model with the thick lid and monochromatic. this one looked nice but it's not so good if your lid cracks.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Cracked Lid After 6 Months - Common Problem!
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this product. Had this product 6 months and found the lid cracked in the center. The lid is also awkward to use and I question how air tight the seal is. Company website indicated product is warranted for 1 year and to contact the retailer for claims. Amazon's customer service handled my complaint nicely. Amazon will also be investigating since there are several other customers experiencing the same defective lid issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Wiliams

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons but overall I like it
customer_reviews.text: Pro: compact size, can easily fit under a large cabinet space (i have it in a pantry stacked), you can write on the lid what it is Con: barely fit a 40lb bag of costco brand dog food with smallish nuggets (says it fits 45lbs), difficult to unscrew with one hand, if you don’t get the lid threaded right it will just spin (maybe thats a child proof design?), difficult to stand up and fill (wobbly)
customer_reviews.author: The Little Engine that could

customer_reviews.title: Great Secure Pet Food Storage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Vittles Vault after having raccoons continually getting into my garage and destroying my pet food containers and eating the contents. Multiple times the raccoons returned to their expected food source, and not for a lack of trying were unsuccessful at getting into the Vittles Vault. Mine have been scratched, bitten and thrown around the garage and never lost their integrity; yet they stack well and are easy to open!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Damaged, Must Return
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in undamaged box but product was damaged. First problem was a common one seen here...the opening is significantly warped into into an oval about 1" displaced from a circle. This cause the lid to not fit without serious force. This is clearly caused by the product being stored on its side (probably stacked under load) instead of upright. The second damage was to the two front feet, both with indentations that could not be pushed out. Disappointed to see the reviews ring true for this one after receing two smaller versions that were not damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Harris

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Does what need to be done I guess, but could be better. The brown plastic came off bucket tried to put it back on but wouldn't stay so I threw it away. And the cover is a pain to get on and off. If you don't line it up just right it doesn't screw on right. And the rubber ring that's supposed to stay on to keep air/water tight keeps Rolling off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Issues with lid
customer_reviews.text: This lid on this container was *extremely* difficult to screw on and off. It would take 30seconds or longer to get it on/off. I don't know if something was wrong with it if that's just how they are made. Returned it an got a different one. It also didnt seem very stable and like it would tip forward when there wasn't much food in it.
customer_reviews.author: NRS Book Warehouse

customer_reviews.title: ... they consume different foods and the storage vaults are fantastic it looks great and it doesn't take up too ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two large dogs they consume different foods and the storage vaults are fantastic it looks great and it doesn't take up too much space. I don't have much space in the laundry room or the closet so it's this played out in the open but thankfully it goes well with my kitchen's design. Other containers I had were just two plain and ugly and not stackable which took more space. Personally love it and highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Pet food container.
customer_reviews.text: Great size, stackable. I have had no problem with these....no slipping, or falling off. They are a little flimsy around the opening; could improve on this.They come with scoops, but doesn't give measurements. I had to measure, as my dogs started gaining weight, and each scoop is abt 1 1/2 C. I like these better the others because this unit is easier to keep clean. I like they are more narrow then others. If you have limited space, theses will work. I do recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless lid
customer_reviews.text: 100% not easy to use lid. My grandma originally wanted it because she thought it would be better looking than the outside version. Turns out the reverse was true for her. Never could open the lid so I immediately returned it. We bought the outside version and are completely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniela H.

customer_reviews.title: Poor design & construction
customer_reviews.text: Although the capacity is great the container lid design is horrible with no true grippable handle, compounded by bad construction in an imperfect circular opening. As a result the lid is very difficult to get on and off. This could be resolved if they would just create a true handle on the lid. Which should be manufactured and sent out to customers as a replacement for the included unusable junk lid.
customer_reviews.author: J.Squires

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews that complained about the covers being difficult to screw back on. I can see where it might be cumbersome to some but I found after 2 or 3 times taking off and on, I have no trouble at all. I love them and I can now save money by buying larger bags of food knowing it will stay fresh!
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use...
customer_reviews.text: I have other pet food containers from Vittles Vault. I bought this one because it is slim and fit better in the area I want to store the dog food. That being said, I find this very difficult to use because it isn't very easy to pour the dog food (from a large bad 30lb +) into with the given angle but more importantly - I find lining up the lid to screw it on is a pain on this and the other Vittles Vault pet food containers I have had. Was hoping this one would be different. Not wise to be optimistic when history shows you reality.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne SJ McNaron

customer_reviews.title: Great food storage.
customer_reviews.text: Great food storage. Only improvement I would make is change it so it can stand the tall way or the short way, and add a place to put wheels on it if desired in the case of only needing one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Raven H.

customer_reviews.title: Lower Quality compared to original.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item having had an original one for years. This is nothing like the original the lid is very hard to take off and put back on. My item arrived damaged. The plastic of the container is much thinner.
customer_reviews.author: Jorak

customer_reviews.title: It will work, but it’s not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This will work, but it is flimsy compared to a Vittles Vault I’ve had for years. I bought the 65+ home collection because I needed to store 50 pounds of dog food in a narrow space in my home. It takes the whole bag and still has some room. Though, I doubt it would hold another 15 pounds. As others have mentioned, the lid doesn’t seem to seal tightly. It will work for my application indoors, but I expected it to be sturdier with a tighter seal, and I wouldn’t suggest it for outdoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Vandiford

customer_reviews.title: Hassle to fill
customer_reviews.text: This container is good for treats but I would not recommend it for storing dry pet food. It's an absolute pain to try to fill the container with a 35 pound bag of dog food. I would definitely not recommend this for storing food.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Utah

customer_reviews.title: Works great but...
customer_reviews.text: Works great keeps out bugs, the dogs, and toddlers. The one downside is the having to wash it due to the material break down. But the opening is big enough that cleaning isn't that bad.
customer_reviews.author: ALISHA K WEBSTER

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bin!
customer_reviews.text: Our previous bin was too large and on wheels. Living in an apartment, I had trouble finding a place to put it out of sight. We have cabinet space in our kitchen and this bin fits perfectly. It also contains the smell really well! Some other reviewers complained about the lid, but it hasn't been an issue for us.
customer_reviews.author: kirkae

customer_reviews.title: Perfect storage container for dog food
customer_reviews.text: Finally a container that can outlast an evening of raccoons. Thankfully this container has diminished the frequency of our outdoor friends and now we just worry about finding our pups half way in the container if we leave it open.
customer_reviews.author: T.O.

customer_reviews.title: Great container for kibble
customer_reviews.text: I got this specially for it to hold my dogs kibble. It's a great product and holds a 40 pound bag of food easily. However, opening and closing it is a bit awkward, it needs more of a handle so you can turn it with ease. That's the only drawback. It's slim and not obtrusive at all. The size is actually deceiving - you wouldn't think it would hold as much. Price on Amazon was $20.00 cheaper than my local Petco.
customer_reviews.author: Marobweiss

customer_reviews.title: Tedious
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept, but the execution falls short for me. The threading on the lid makes it very difficult to replace. Becomes pretty tedious every time.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine O

customer_reviews.title: Slim and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: VERY nice! I've been through a few different containers for my pals' food. They each have a different food due to allergies, so the stacking is important to me, so I can save space in my laundry room. These are narrow, sturdy and really stack well. The screw on lid works well to keep my curious 'boys' out of their nummies. So glad I found these, and game them a try. Definitely (as of now), would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: NoMIFish

customer_reviews.title: Works, but is too hard to screw on the lid.
customer_reviews.text: It is a good size and holds a lot of dog food. Seems to keep it fresh. The only issue I'm having is with the lid. It is not easy to thread and seems to get cross threaded easily. I have to press down and turn it counter clockwise until I hear the threads click, then turn it clockwise to seal. It's a pain and my wife cannot do it. Will probably get a better on sooner or later. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Meacham

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog food storage in a small space.
customer_reviews.text: Nice dog food holder. Fits perfectly in a small space and hold ALOT of dog food around a 50lb bag. I like this better than just leaving the dog food bag sitting out it looks a lot nicer!
customer_reviews.author: essn1977

customer_reviews.title: It does what its supposed to, but not very well.
customer_reviews.text: It's not a bad container, but the problems lie in the opening. The lid itself is pretty difficult to remove and replace and it takes quite a bit of effort to line it up properly to close it and even more effort to remove, most likely impossible for people with dexterity issues. The opening is also too small and placed in such an awkward angle, putting the dog food in is such a chore. It does what it's supposed to, but not in a very user friendly manner.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bensinger

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality, but has a good seal
customer_reviews.text: Product came with a dent in the bottom. The lids are difficult to twist on and off. The material used for these are not the greatest. Has a good seal though.
customer_reviews.author: Afulks

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Product is very thin and arrived with the feet already crushed in. This obviously speaks volumes of the quality. They are very narrow and tip easily. I wouldn't recommend. I sent mine back!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought two to hold horse grain. The description says they hold 45lbs. I was able to load it up with 50 lbs of grain and still have room for more.
customer_reviews.author: gina

customer_reviews.title: Very big
customer_reviews.text: This is very large, which is what I wanted. The lid design could be better. It isn't as sturdy as some and not as easy to get off either.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg M

customer_reviews.title: Large, durable, dont like the twist top.
customer_reviews.text: Very durable. The twist top is not smooth so its a pain to open and close. The manufacturer needs to fix this issue with a different type of thread for the screw on top. Larger than i expected it to be, not a complaint just an observation.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea K. Charbonneau

customer_reviews.title: Not their finest work..
customer_reviews.text: The dark plastic face pops off all the time. The lid seems warped or something and comes loose if "over" tightened. The rubber gasket and container smelled of harsh chemicals so we wound up not using it. Over the years we have been very satisfied with this company's containers, and guess maybe this one was a dud?
customer_reviews.author: andy beringer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: The tops of these are nearly impossible to twist off. We struggle with them daily and try to gently place the tops on so we don’t have to wrestle them off. It such a huge design flaw that I would not recommend these. They are great in theory, but it took me a solid 5 minutes one day to get a top off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Plastic is thin and lid does not seat properly to screw down. It skips threads and goes on crooked until you fiddle with it.
customer_reviews.author: Coupon Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Good size/shape, but not as sturdy/quality as the original model.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t seem as sturdy and high quality as the old, boxy version of Vittles Vault we replaced, but the size is great! The lid isn’t as quick to turn / remove like the old one either.
customer_reviews.author: aleicoleman

customer_reviews.title: missing parts
customer_reviews.text: this vittles vault came with the black top plastic and no food cup thatt is why i only gave it 2 stars, other than that it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Airtight
customer_reviews.text: Not Airtight Food Container. We bought this to store our dogs’ food. We have had rodents biting through our last container. The important feature was the air tight seal and rodent proof design. However, this container doesn’t have an airtight seal. As you turn to seal it slips and becomes loose again and it goes into an infinite loop that doesn’t seal. We are concerned with moisture getting into the food (causing bacterial growth) and since its not sealed it will attract rodents trying to access food.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Cute storage
customer_reviews.text: If you want a food storage and want it to look nice, this is definitely your container. The only problem I have is, I have to play with the lid to get it straight. That could be just user error.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Clark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our dog food
customer_reviews.text: We use multiple of them. Nice is that they have straight sidewalls and therefore no waste of space. Also the opening is perfect especially if you store the container in a cabinet ... And the are airtight .
customer_reviews.author: Florian

customer_reviews.title: Great container with included scoop, screw on lid and rubber gasket
customer_reviews.text: Love the size of this and can fit a 45+ lb bag of dog food easily. Comes with a handy scoop that matches the white. Has a rubber seal to keep out moisture, not sure how effective this is as I keep it in my kitchen but the screw on lid is secure. 9"wx21.5"Lx21"h
customer_reviews.author: WillithicaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: awesome simple product. It keeps the dog food fresh and keeps my German Shepherd out of it. I will highly recommend this to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Dathan

customer_reviews.title: Lid didn't fit
customer_reviews.text: Lid didn't fit. Upon checking other reviews, all mentioned the same problem. Had to return item.
customer_reviews.author: Tami A. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Decent food storage
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased these for our dog food closet. It’s easy to pour the food in with the attachments that come with it. Only downfall is the caps are a bit difficult to take on an off & can become very annoying after awhile. Overall it’s a good product- just wish the cap was easier to take on and off
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best dog food container!!
customer_reviews.text: This product holds so much dog food and still manages to fit into the smallest of spaces!! This is a great way to prevent dog food from getting stale and saves space. I hate clutter and i love that this allows me to have 50 lbs of dog food on hand but you would never know because i don't have dog food bags laying around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Felicity

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be cheap, you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Do not order this product very flimsy, the lid does not fit properly and it says a 45lb capacity, I buy a 44lb bag from Sam’s club and had a quarter of the bag left, because it wouldn’t fit. Spend a little extra at the pet store and you will be better off!
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Very Thin one had split along back.
customer_reviews.text: I would just buy food-grade containers with locking lid. These are way too thin and just made for the pet trade so standards seem low.
customer_reviews.author: Aetoole

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to screw open and closed
customer_reviews.text: The lids are difficult and awkward to twist off. The finger grooves just aren’t big enough
customer_reviews.author: Dana Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Rice Holder
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this! I use it to store 50lbs of rice. It holds a bit more than that! Easy to get rice without dropping a single grain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This holds it in pretty good, just make sure you don't tilt it ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to hold our Mastiff puppy's food, as he would locate the bag and tear into it when we weren't paying attention. This holds it in pretty good, just make sure you don't tilt it to fill or you might spill it out when you set it back down flat.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Smith

customer_reviews.title: Used outdoors to hold grill wood pellets
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to sit outside to hold wood pellets for our grill. Airtight and perfect angle for easy scooping!
customer_reviews.author: Mamaof2

customer_reviews.title: Pointless Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Pointless Purchase. It is pretty tough to get the lid on/off & we had it literally 3 days & our dog was able to chew a hole in the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget8

customer_reviews.title: Does what we need it to but lid is deformed
customer_reviews.text: Stores pet food as any plastic with a threaded lid would. Our only complaint is with the male threaded portion being oval shaped. We have to pull and beat on the lid to remove or place lid. Not difficult, but not perfect either. Probably wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Krystle

customer_reviews.title: LID BROKEN ON ARRIVAL.
customer_reviews.text: This is not heavy duty by any means. Arrived broken, lid does not fit. Requestion a full refund. NOT HAPPY
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Lid came cracked.
customer_reviews.text: Great container except for the cracked lid!! And it appears the crack was covered up with a sticker before being shipped. Not cool. Would like a new not cracked lid please.
customer_reviews.author: Faith76

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but not as I expected
customer_reviews.text: It came on time and looks threat. The lid is very difficult to put on though. Also very difficult to move around once full as it doesn't have any handles to grab it from. It did not fill the amount of food that it stated.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa H. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it’s due to manufacturing or shipping but these things get beat up before you get them.
customer_reviews.text: The container arrived with server all dents on the body of it, Which I can live with because I intend to put it in a cabinet. They are small and not very noticeable. However, the lid is broken which really sucks because this is so expensive. Mine is already full of dog food so I can’t really send it back, I don’t have bother container to use in the meantime. Maybe there’s a way to just get a new lid from the manufacturer since it has a warranty. Can’t really give it any more than one star since it’s definitely not airtight and that’s what you’re paying for.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B

customer_reviews.title: Very good product!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this container for cat food. Would re purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Robyn L. Tegtmeier

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great about these but we did return due to finding the sane oroduct & name at Sams Club for less. I did want wheels but that which this product has but still went for the others we found that carried 60lbs of rice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: convenient and durable, not as easy to open and close
customer_reviews.text: I also don't know how good is going to be keeping the foos fresh
customer_reviews.author: Cleopatra

customer_reviews.title: Hard to open!
customer_reviews.text: I am having a very hard time opening the container. I bought a smaller one too for cat food and there is no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Roni Illias

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This vault holds a full bag of dog food and more. Nice and compact, I am able to fit it in my pantry keeping it out of sight. The lid does seem a bit thin on the edges so I wonder if it will last, but so far it hasn't been a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Davis

customer_reviews.title: Prefer the older design
customer_reviews.text: Lid is a bit difficult to open and close. I preferred the previous design.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Awful. Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely AWFUL!!! It’s such a pain to return items right now too which the pandemic, I’m so frustrated! I bought two and both of them have super terrible kids that are a huge hassle to untwist and retighten. Wresting match every time, in both containers.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold as much as it says
customer_reviews.text: Does not hold 60 lbs or even 50 lbs of dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Great product and the smaller one we bought from PetSmart ...
customer_reviews.text: Does fit 2 large bags of my prescription food for the large dog, however I do not use the provided scoop as I tried it and it was slightly off measurement, as I have a large dog it is important for me to measure the food to make sure it lasts as intended. Great product and the smaller one we bought from PetSmart easily stacks on top.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great!! after one tweak.
customer_reviews.text: Love it, only thing is the rubber gasket doesn't stay it its groove, have to tack it down with dabs of rtv silicone to secure. Years of service expected after proper refurbishment.
customer_reviews.author: K Morris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product 40 lb bag fits just right
customer_reviews.text: Was worried about holding a 40 lb. bag of food but it fit with no problem. The seal on lid is great and seems very durable keeps food fresh, is Compact and would recommend
customer_reviews.author: harry

customer_reviews.title: Good Container - Not so good Lid
customer_reviews.text: This is an all around good pet food container but the lid is a bit difficult to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Allan May

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Dog Food Storage Container
customer_reviews.text: This container is sturdy and keeps the food dry and within easy reach. It's also stackable in case I need a 2nd one. Importantly, my super-smart German Shepherd has not [yet] figured out how to open it :)
customer_reviews.author: Doc Patel

customer_reviews.title: Holds 50lbs of dry goods
customer_reviews.text: Great for stocking up on sugar or dry goods in a small space
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Good but.....
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Very stable when stacked 2 high. I give it 4 stars because the 45# box barely holds a 35# bag of dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, it has removed the bags of dog food off the floor. The lid is a little odd and doesn't seem to fit correctly but that doesn't bother me to much, I'm just glad to have the dog food in a storage bin now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to keep the dog food fresh.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to seal well. A little bit tricky to get the lid threaded on right but I think I got the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Fits inside of my small cabinet under my counter top. It is currently holding about 40+lbs of food and works great. Very sturdy. My dog is kenneled when I'm not around, but I'm not concerned about her ever breaking in to this.
customer_reviews.author: Kate B

customer_reviews.title: It's Bigger on the Inside!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried when I initially bought this because some reviews said it did not hold the advertised amount of food. and then when it arrived and opened the box it looked a bit small. However, it held the entire 40lbs bag of kirkland brand adult dog food with plenty of room to spare
customer_reviews.author: Unrulyemu

customer_reviews.title: Great for bulk popcorn.
customer_reviews.text: Yep, got this to hold 25 pound bags of popcorn from Sam's. Works great, easy access for one cup at a time. Seals great, easy open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Terry J. Keaton

customer_reviews.title: Good product, compact design
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, it works well and is a compact design. Way over priced however.
customer_reviews.author: John Baker

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Lids seemingly all come warped, are very difficult to get on and off, and don't seal at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy D.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food fresh and mice out
customer_reviews.text: It is a great way to store dog food so we don't have to keep in bags. With this we can stick up and store in the garage and nice won't get in.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane Espardinez

customer_reviews.title: Flour Container
customer_reviews.text: 40 pounder easily fit 50 pounds of flour. Nice, sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Ava Goemo

customer_reviews.title: Get the Outback series not the Home series
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 from Amazon and the lid was cracked on them just like other customers. When I received replacements directly from Gamma 2 another one was cracked. I have had the outback series for 8 years and no issues. Don't waste your time with the home series. The lids are junk. I highly recommend the outback series though. And they are cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Critical thinker

customer_reviews.title: Round lid... Oval shaped opening?
customer_reviews.text: The brand is usually fantastic and a lifesaver. I got a defective product with a round lid but an oval opening. Not something I want to live with for the next 5 years... Exchanging!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra W

product_meta.title: Gamma Vittles Vault Stackable Home Collection Containers
product_meta.description: Size:45+ lbsThe All New Home collection Vittles Vault Stackable 45+ has an all new design from the new sleek look to the stay fresh lid.
feature_bullets: The absolutely airtight storage container for dry pet foods
Lock in freshness and flavor with a spin of the Vittles Vault patented lid
